participant_abstract.sent: Heather opened the meeting just after 12pm. Poppy gave a powerpoint presentation on the working design of our product.
She spoke about the visibility of the remote, its 'findability' and the idea of creating a remote that has smart materials that allow for easy dismanteling, recycling and reusing.

After Poppy, Tara gave her presentation regarding the technical functions of the remote, mainly whether it should be single-functional (just for TV) or multi-functional (for several electronica devices- DVD, CD, game consuls, etc).
I gave the final presentation on the user requirement specs.
I outlined the priorities of Real Remote (fashion, user friendly, effective) and went on to describe the findings of my market research and interviews.
After this, Heather informed us of the decisions from management, namely, that it be single-functional, not use tele-text, incorporates company colour and logo.
The meeting ended well, with the four participants coming to some important decisions based on our individual research.

The most important decisions were that we will not use LCD or voice-recognition devices, we will have a minimum amount of buttons, an alarm system to find the remote and design buttons that are tactile and temporarily light-up.
We briefly discussed the option of having various unique faceplates that the public could choose based on their personal preferences (compare to the current i-Pod marketing).

participant_decisions.sent: As per management executive decisions: -remote will be single-functional: for TVs only .
We will not concern ourselves with teletext.
The design will incorporate our logo and colour .
As result of meeting discussion and research sharing: -buttons will be decipherable in the dark with use of tactile design.
We will limit amount of buttons .
Agreed to avoid the glow-in-the-dark look due to tacky look, also not battery efficient if it's power-based.
We agreed on a temporary light-up method, similar to the way cell phones light up when a button is touched .
Agree on alarm system: small paging system that can be stuck somewhere near/on TV. -we will stick to our purpose of creating a simple, fashionable and user-friendly remote control .

participant_problems.sent: Discussion on whether to put money into environmental research: Poppy spoke about smart materials that we could use, Heather was concerned about financial implications.
We are to come to a decision soon.
Only briefly discussed face-plate idea: we will need to do more research.
